abstract: Prison officials say inmate Rakhat Aliyev, who was found hanged in his cell, committed suicide in Vienna jail where he was awaiting trial in kidnapping and murder of two Kazakhstan bank officials; Aliyev, estranged son-in-law of Kazakhstan's Pres Nursultan Nazarbayev, was due to testify against former cellmates whom he said threatened him; Aliyev's lawyers call for investigation.
lead_paragraph: Officials at a Vienna prison say the death of Rakhat Aliyev, former son-in-law of President Nursultan Nazarbayev of Kazakhstan, was clearly suicide, but Mr. Aliyev’s lawyers are not convinced.

headline.main: Ex-Member of Kazakhstan’s Inner Circle Dies in Vienna Jail
headline.print_headline: A Former Insider From Kazakhstan Dies in a Vienna Jail

snippet: Officials at a Vienna prison say the death of Rakhat Aliyev, former son-in-law of President Nursultan Nazarbayev of Kazakhstan, was clearly suicide, but Mr. Aliyev’s lawyers are not convinced.
